column4: not for sure unless its using a generic wifi driver might have to wait till you can install the actual drivers for it either with the ndiswrapper or get the actual linux driver
wondering if either is better than lubuntu for a lightweight 64 bit os
I've used bodhi and don't think it's lighter than lubuntu, plus E17 is still under heavy development, not suitable for daily usage, if you ask me.
